meanings.definition: Resembling a pillow in softness or comfort.
meanings.sent1: The blanket was pillowier than the hard ground beneath it.
meanings.sent2: She loved her pillowier mattress because it felt like sleeping on a cloud.
meanings.sent3: The pillowier marshmallows were a hit at the campfire.
meanings.sent4: His voice was so pillowier, it was like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The pillowier fabric of the new sofa made it irresistible for napping.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a pillow.
meanings.sent1: The pillowier cushions on the couch made it perfect for lounging.
meanings.sent2: Her pillowier hugs always made him feel safe and loved.
meanings.sent3: The pillowier clouds in the sky seemed extra fluffy that day.
meanings.sent4: The pillowier clouds floated lazily across the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The pillowier texture of the cake made it melt in your mouth.

meanings.definition: More pillow-like in appearance or feel.
meanings.sent1: The pillowier clouds in the sky looked like cotton candy.
meanings.sent2: The pillowier fabric of the dress made it perfect for a cozy night out.
meanings.sent3: The pillowier snowflakes fell gently to the ground, creating a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent4: Her pillowier hair cascaded down her back like a soft waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The pillowier texture of the ice cream made it a delightful treat on a hot day.
